results.question: What is the definition of deferred revenues?

Deferred revenues are typically recognized over the period in which the performance obligation is incurred. Deferred revenues can be deferred over a period of time, which is measured by the life of the performance obligation. Deferred revenue is a performance obligation that is incurred when the customer has yet to receive the amount of revenue that is deferred to it. Deferred revenue is typically recognized when the performance obligation is incurred.
results.json_rows_response: Deferred revenues consist of deferred revenue and deferred revenue related to deferred revenue. Deferred revenue related to deferred revenue is revenue that is deferred due to a performance obligation for which payments have been received by the customer prior to revenue recognition. Deferred revenue is revenue that is deferred due to performance obligations that are not expected to be collected in the future.

results.question: Why did the company exclude certain expenses from their calculation of Adjusted EBITDA?
gold_answer: facilitates comparisons of our operating performance on a period-to-period basis and, in the case of exclusion of acquisition-related expense and certain historical legal expenses, excludes items that we do not consider to be indicative of our core operating performance.
results.markdown_table_response: As a company-wide measure of our performance, Adjusted EBITDA has limitations in that it does not reflect the impact of all items in our GAAP results. For example, our share of the gains on the sale of assets is not included in our GAAP results, but is included in Adjusted EBITDA. Likewise, our share of expenses incurred in connection with the sale of assets is not included in our GAAP results, but is included in Adjusted EBITDA. In addition, as a company-wide measure, Adjusted EBITDA does not reflect the impact of depreciation and amortization, which is an expense of our business.
results.csv_string_response: Adjusted EBITDA is an important measure used by our management and board of directors to understand and evaluate our core operating performance and trends, to generate future operating plans, to make strategic decisions regarding the allocation of capital and to make investments in initiatives that are focused on cultivating new markets for our solutions. To calculate Adjusted EBITDA, we exclude certain expenses that are not indicative of our core operating performance. These expenses are acquisition-related expense, stock-based compensation expense, litigation expense, provision for income taxes and amortization and depreciation expense.
results.json_rows_response: We excluded certain expenses from our calculation of Adjusted EBITDA because they are non-cash charges that are related to the acquisition of certain assets and which are not indicative of our core operating performance. These items include a portion of the acquisition-related legal expenses that we incurred in connection with the acquisition of our business and technology partner.
